title: Trump has done one thing really well as US President
description:
• Analysis: This is the most concerning thing Woodward has said about Trump
• Timeline: Trump's public comments on Covid-19 vs. what he told Woodward in private

title: Trump says he 'conceptually' doesn't like a TikTok deal that leaves ByteDance with majority control
description: President Trump said Wednesday he was "not going to be happy" if the viral video app TikTok continues to be majority-owned by ByteDance, its Chinese parent company.

title: Analysis: Trump's answer on how the pandemic will end is not exactly comforting
description: During a town hall on ABC Tuesday night, moderator George Stephanopoulos asked President Donald Trump why he said that he liked to "downplay" the threat posed by Covid-19 to the American public.

title: A Boston University lecturer was killed in an elevator accident
description: A respected French lecturer at Boston University was killed in what is believed to be a freak elevator accident.

title: CNN's Kaitlan Collins fires back at McEnany over Trump's mask claim
description: CNN's Kaitlan Collins fact checks White House Press Secretary Kayleigh McEnany over President Trump's latest claim casting doubts on wearing masks.

title: Trump contradicts and demeans CDC director over vaccine testimony
Glacier National Park may no longer live up to its name soon
description: Glacier National Park, one of America's original 10 national parks, could lose its glaciers completely within decades. What would the park look like in the next century then, without the glaciers that feed the wildlife, farms and people who depend on it?

title: 'SNL' is getting a new Joe Biden
description: "Saturday Night Live" has found its Joe Biden.

title: Fed pledges to keep interest rates near zero for years
description: The Federal Reserve committed Wednesday to do more to help the US economic recovery, promising more asset purchases and lower interest rates for even longer than it previously expected.

title: Does Trump know what's real and what isn't? Bob Woodward doesn't think so
This is how we should build on Mars, scientists say
description: If we make it to Mars, we're not going to be able to bring everything humankind needs to stay for an extended period of time -- or to construct colonies on the red planet.

title: HHS says spokesman will take a two-month 'leave of absence' following apology for conspiracy-laden rant
description: Michael Caputo, the top spokesman at the Department of Health and Human Services, is taking a two-month leave of absence from his post, the department announced Wednesday, a day after he apologized for a conspiracy theory-laden rant he made against career government scientists in which he accused them of "sedition" and working to undermine President Donald Trump.

title: Voter after asking Trump question: I broke down and cried
description: Ellesia Blaque, who lives with the the chronic medical conditions sarcoidosis and neurosarcoidosis, asked President Donald Trump about his healthcare plan at an ABC town hall. She tells CNN's Brianna Keilar about the experience and how she reacted to Trump's answer.

title: He was once one of sport's most influential men. Now he has been jailed for corruption
description: The former head of athletics' governing body, Lamine Diack, has been sentenced to two years in prison after being found guilty on charges of corruption related to the Russian doping scandal, a Paris courthouse announced on Wednesday.

title: One of the world's biggest T. rex skeletons is up for sale
description: One of the world's most complete Tyrannosaurus rex skeletons is up for sale.

title: Amnesty calls for investigation into video showing execution of woman in Mozambique
description: Amnesty International has called for an immediate investigation into the apparent extrajudicial killing of a woman in Mozambique that was shared widely in a horrifying video on social media earlier this week.

title: The US has a horrifying history of forced sterilizations. Some fear a new chapter is beginning
description: Natalia Molina was shocked when she heard a whistleblower's allegations about hysterectomies in ICE custody. But also, she wasn't.

title: Melania Trump bronze replaces wooden statue damaged by arsonists
description: A bronze statue of Melania Trump has been put up near her hometown in Slovenia to replace a wooden version which was damaged in an arson attack in July.

title: 5 Chinese nationals among those charged with cyberhacking that victimized over 100 companies and people worldwide
description: Five Chinese and two Malaysian international cyberhackers were indicted in federal court on Wednesday for allegedly intruding on over 100 companies and people in the US and abroad through online games to launder "millions of dollars," the Justice Department announced Wednesday.

title: This previously unknown mass extinction gave rise to dinosaurs, scientists say
description: A newly identified mass extinction event took place 233 million years ago and was likely caused by massive volcanic eruptions in what is now western Canada.

title: 13-year-old boy sentenced to 10 years in prison for blasphemy
description: Child rights agency UNICEF has condemned the sentencing of a 13-year-old boy to 10 years in prison for blasphemy in northern Nigeria.

title: Bus passenger uses live snake as a face mask
description: Transportation officials in the UK have warned commuters not to use live snakes as face coverings, after a bus passenger was spotted with a large reptile wrapped around his head.

title: WNBA star marries man whose wrongful prison sentence she helped overturn
description: Four-time WNBA champion Maya Moore has tied the knot with Jonathan Irons, the man whose wrongful conviction she helped overturn.

title: Twitter's tiny warning labels no match for Trump's tweets
description: Twitter on Wednesday flagged as "manipulated media" a tweet that President Trump had sent some hours earlier, which featured a video of his opponent Joe Biden, but with the song "Despacito" that Biden had been playing replaced with another song, "F**k Tha Police."

title: France's soccer chief thinks racism in soccer 'does not exist' despite high-profile incidents
description: French Football Federation (FFF) president Noel Le Graet says racism in football "does not exist" following accusations made by Paris Saint-Germain forward Neymar.

title: In Malaysia, Darth Vader is leading a shadow puppetry revival
description: The Force is strong in Tinto Chou. The shadow puppet designer is using "Star Wars" characters like Darth Vader, Princess Leia and Luke Skywalker to get audiences interested in the ancient art of wayang kulit. We visit Chou in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, to see how he and a 13th generation master puppeteer known as Pak Dain are taking delighted audiences to a galaxy far, far away with every epic performance.

title: Floodwaters turn streets into rivers as Sally swamps South
Actress got a shock when she checked on daughters' Zoom class
description: HLN's Melissa Knowles reports on Kristen Bell's story of finding her kids drinking non-alcoholic beers during school Zoom class.

title: Trump administration is trying to keep census documents secret
description: The Trump administration is trying to get a federal judge to help shield thousands of internal documents about the 2020 census from the public.

title: Giant planet found orbiting a dead white dwarf star
description: For the first time, a planet has been discovered orbiting a white dwarf, also known as a dead star.

title: Alien Huang, Taiwanese actor and singer, dead at 36
description: Taiwanese singer and actor Alien Huang has died at the age of 36.

title: Everything you thought you knew about the Vikings may be wrong
description: Blond-haired, Scandinavian warriors who pillaged their way through Europe.

title: PTSD may double risk of dementia, new analysis finds
description: People who experience post-traumatic stress disorder may be twice as likely to have dementia later in life, according to a new study -- a finding with important implications for the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Jennifer Aniston and Brad Pitt reunited again, this time for a good cause
description: History has shown us that people get pretty excited whenever Jennifer Aniston and Brad Pitt are within the vicinity of each other.

title: CNN reporter struggles to brave Hurricane Sally winds
description: Hurricane Sally has brought flooding and storm surge to several coastal communities, prompting the evacuation of thousands of people directly in its path. CNN reporter Gary Tuchman reports on the conditions in Pensacola Beach, Florida.

title: The US President faced life outside his own political bubble, where his self-congratulation failed to meet the moment when he was confronted by undecided voters
Barbados will drop the British Queen as head of state next year
description: Barbados will remove Queen Elizabeth II as its head of state and become a republic by next year, its government has announced, making it the first country to drop the monarch in nearly three decades.

title: Why Mexico's president tried to create a raffle with a $218 million plane as the prize
description: Sixteen immaculately dressed children walked onstage Tuesday in Mexico's National Lottery building, a few yelling the day's winning numbers in a distinct staccato.

title: See inside presidential plane Mexico tried to raffle
description: CNN's Matt Rivers breaks down the strange saga of Mexico's presidential plane, which President Andrés Manuel López Obrador has been trying to get rid of since he took power in December 2018.

title: World's 10 most scenic airport landings
description: They say absence makes the heart grow fonder.

title: Smoke from the US West Coast wildfires has reached Europe
description: The wildfires devastating California and other parts of the western United States are the worst in 18 years, with vast amounts of thick smoke affecting large areas of the North America and even reaching Northern Europe, scientists said Wednesday.

title: Germany to take in 1,500 migrants from Greece, after huge fire left thousands homeless
description: Germany will take more than 1,500 migrants currently sheltering on Greek islands, Chancellor Angela Merkel's spokesperson Steffen Seibert announced Tuesday.

title: NBA All-Star 'Melo' Anthony launches a streetwear collection at New York Fashion Week
description: Portland Trail Blazers small forward and ten-time NBA All-Star Carmelo "Melo" Anthony has launched a collection of T-shirts, hoodies and sweatshirts in collaboration with seven New York and New Jersey-based independent designers.

title: Thomas Cook relaunches as an online travel business under Chinese ownership
description: Thomas Cook is back — this time, with a different business model.

title: The countries that no longer exist
description: Despite its exotic name, there's a very good reason you've never booked a vacation to the Quilombo of Palmeres. Same goes for the Islands of Refreshment, the Fiume Endeavour and Neutral Moresnet.

title: Is this the most important difference between Trump and Biden?
description: The wildfires are on the West Coast, but haze from the smoke has reached New York City.

title: Two Arab nations embraced ties with Israel at the White House. Here's what's in it for all sides
description: On Tuesday, US President Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will join the foreign ministers of the United Arab Emirates and Bahrain at the White House to mark historic normalization agreements between Israel and the two Arab countries.

title: 7 steps that can lower your blood pressure as you age
description: Want to live a longer, healthier life? One way is to keep your blood pressure at optimal levels as you age -- preferably below 120 systolic (the top number) and 80 diastolic (the lower number).

title: The outlook for top global economies is improving, OECD says
description: The huge shock to many of the world's biggest economies from the coronavirus pandemic may not be quite as bad as economists feared just a few months ago.

title: Hardwood floor from Kobe Bryant's final game expected to auction for more than $500,000
description: The late Kobe Bryant announced his retirement from basketball in November 2015 in a poem entitled "Dear Basketball."

title: Why Kim Kardashian West froze her Instagram account
description: Kim Kardashian West, who has one of the biggest Instagram followings in the world, said Tuesday that she would be joining other high-profile users in a protest against Instagram's parent company Facebook and its handlng of misinformation and hate.

title: 'Experimental concentration camp': Whistleblower details alarming rate of hysterectomies at ICE facility
description: A whistleblower who previously worked at an Immigration and Customs Enforcement facility in Georgia detailed a high rate of hysterectomies and alleged medical neglect in a complaint filed to the Department of Homeland Security inspector general Monday.

title: Yoshihide Suga officially named as Japan's new Prime Minister, replacing Shinzo Abe
description: Yoshihide Suga has been elected Japan's new Prime Minister following a vote in the country's Parliament on Wednesday, confirming the former cardboard factory worker and farmer's son as leader of the world's third largest economy.

title: Online classes: 5 reasons students benefit from 'cameras off'
description: As the 2020 to 2021 school year gets underway -- both at the K through 12 and college level -- many students find themselves attending online classes via Zoom or similar teleconferencing platforms.

title: How to help siblings get along better
description: Sibling rivalry is often taken as an unexamined fact of family life -- as much a part of parenting as potty training or bedtime stories.

title: Magnus Carlsen has conquered the world of chess. Now he's setting his sights on fantasy football
description: Magnus Carlsen, the best chess player on the planet, should have been focusing on a match with the talented Chinese player Ding Liren in a renowned online tournament on a summery Sunday in July.

title: Pakistan's Prime Minister calls for chemical castration of those convicted of rape
description: Pakistan's Prime Minister Imran Khan called for rapists and child molesters to be chemically castrated when asked in an interview about a rape that garnered national attention in Pakistan.

title: The world set a 2020 deadline to save nature but not a single target was met, UN report says
description: In 2010, leaders from 196 countries gathered in Japan and agreed on a list of goals designed to save the Earth.

title: Man Trump called 'my African-American' says life hasn't been the same
description: Gregory Cheadle, the man then presidential candidate Donald Trump referred to as "my African-American" in 2016, shares how his life has changed.

title: Island hopping in Maldives
description: In the turquoise waters of the Indian Ocean, Maldives is made up of more than 1,000 islands, which tourists travel between on seaplanes.

title: Father of Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates dies at 94
description: The father of Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates died Monday, according to his son. William Henry Gates II was 94 years old.

title: Black voter asks President Trump if he's aware how 'tone-deaf' MAGA slogan is
description: During an ABC town hall, President Trump was asked by a Black voter how his campaign slogan "Make America Great Again" is inclusive of African Americans.

title: Voter to President Donald Trump: Let me finish, sir
description: CNN's Don Lemon reacts to some moments from ABC's town hall with President Donald Trump where he was confronted by voters about a variety of issues, including the Covid-19 pandemic and healthcare.

title: A Bollywood song referring to Beyoncé has its lyrics changed after backlash over colorism
description: In an upcoming Bollywood film called "Khaali Peeli," there's dancing, music and a song with a controversial chorus: "When you dance, watching you, oh fair-skinned girl, Beyoncé will be ashamed."

title: CNN anchor: No one in my 21 years of journalism has sent me a photo like this
description: Sondra Wolfe, who's husband died from coronavirus complications, gives a warning to others who aren't taking the Covid-19 pandemic seriously.

title: Twitter and Facebook shut down accounts linked to youth conservative group's misleading social media campaign
description: Twitter and Facebook have shut down accounts on their platforms reportedly linked to a misleading social media campaign run by Turning Point Action, an offshoot of popular conservative youth activist organization Turning Point USA.

title: Anderson Cooper to Woodward: What you just said is pretty terrifying
description: After many comprehensive interviews with President Trump for his new book, "Rage," veteran journalist Bob Woodward tells CNN's Anderson Cooper the conclusion he came to about the President.

title: Trump dismisses voter questions on how he handled virus
description: President Donald Trump dismissed questions from Pennsylvania voters about his handling of coronavirus, insisting he did act strongly to fight the pandemic and again denied he downplayed the situation despite saying so on tape.

title: Joe Biden's Hispanic voter problem is real
Caffeine company wants to help people sleep with new drink
description: Pepsi tries to make you sleepy with new drink. Internet renames it. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: Apple reveals two new watches, two new iPads and a subscription bundle
